docs.lead_paragraph: As a lactation consultant in Brooklyn, Freda Rosenfeld has helped stressed-out mothers feed their newborns better and eased their fears.

headline.sub: Breast-feeding isn’t easy for everyone.  That’s where Freda Rosenfeld comes in,  holding hands and coaxing tongues.;

docs.lead_paragraph: 8 P.M. (13) FACES OF AMERICA WITH HENRY LOUIS GATES JR. In Episode 2 of his exploration of the history of 12 well-known Americans, Mr. Gates, far right with Stephen Colbert, reveals the stories of immigration behind a few of his subjects. The narratives include those of Mr. Colbert's Irish great-great-grandfather, who escaped poverty and religious oppression in Limerick; Mario Batali's great-grandfather, who left Italy for the mines of Montana; the Syrian great-grandfather of Queen Noor of Jordan, who was part of New York's first Arab-American community; and Kristi Yamaguchi's grandfather, who for decades encountered racial barriers to citizenship. 8 P.M. (NBC) 2010 WINTER OLYMPIC GAMES Prime-time coverage features the men's halfpipe, speed skating and skiing. Other events include men's hockey and men's curling, at 6 a.m. on Universal; women's curling, at noon on the USA Network; men's and women's hockey at 3 p.m. on MSNBC; men's and women's gold-medal sprint in cross-country skiing, at 3 on NBC; men's curling and men's hockey, at 5 on CNBC; women's short track speed skating, at 12:05 a.m. on NBC; and women's curling (tape-delayed) at 3 a.m. on MSNBC.

docs.lead_paragraph: Almost four decades after the federal education law called Title IX opened the door for girls to participate in high school and college athletics, a crucial question has remained unanswered: Do sports make a long-term difference in a woman's life?
